intro: Anthemis iranica, commonly known as Persian chamomile, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Iran. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its yellow flowers with white ray florets. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and has hairy, linear leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky and arid environments. The essential oil extracted from its flowers is used in aromatherapy and traditional medicine for its calming and anti-inflammatory properties.
